contentString: x 2049-06-29 2021-01-26 find this Todo.txt list online
don't invest more than a day - just send us what you've got
find out how to read this file at https://github.com/todotxt/todo.txt
set up a new Java web project with a framework you like
use the absolute minimal amount of external dependencies type:constraint
GET *this* file via HTTP
parse it (you can ignore tags, contexts, due/completion dates if you want)
make your API public (no auth), RESTful and use JSON
allow to get all TODOs via API
allow to get a single TODO by ID (!) via API
show that you know how to unit test
allow to filter TODOs by project via API
allow to sort TODOs by priority via API
allow to get all TODOs in Todo.txt format as well
improve your Todo.txt parser by supporting contexts, tags and testing against gotchas.todo.txt (see README.md) type:feature optional:true
allow to complete a TODO (in memory)
move TODOs with completion status in a in-memory DB (import on startup)
2049-06-30 send the project back via e-mail (zipped) so that we can build and run it locally
please don't make our case study or your solution public
buy milk +shopping
